title: Self-Regulated Learning-Based Critical Thinking Education for Responding to COVID-19 Crisis Situations

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in using basic online learning tools, understanding of fundamental argumentation structures for problem-solving
context.additional_context: Education for pre-professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology settings. Learners analyze real COVID-19-related current issues and propose solutions.

learning_goals: Learners can independently design a COVID-19 problem-solving project using the SRL 5-stage process (Goal Setting → Planning → Execution Monitoring → Reflective Evaluation → Outcome Adjustment).

Learners can apply critical thinking procedures to crisis scenarios (e.g., infection spread, information overload, ethical dilemmas) presented in game-based simulations and provide three or more rational decision-making justifications.
Learners can continuously improve problem-solving processes through peer feedback and self-assessment, and produce a final output in the form of a 10-minute video or infographic report.

resources: COVID-19-Related Open Dataset (Infection Statistics, Policy Documents, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
